ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Throughout the course students gain familiarity with a range of technical and conceptual skills for animation and video making in general.
Historical and technical understanding of animation, movement, and different equipments and software.

I have explored an array of animation techniques within the diverse course projects. The screenings of animations and films, along with the assigned readings during class, have expanded my understanding and challenged the boundaries of traditional animation.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was well designed and allowed students to engage with a variety of source material and methods of creating animations. I also appreciated the use of Yale's extensive archives.
Literally such an epic class. No qualms. every class was so intriguing in a different way.
The course is cohesive, constructive, fun, and experimental.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this class to another student.
Yes! It's a lot of work but worth it. Made me really fall in love with animation.
Yes, the ability to showcase the students' work at Times Square is an exceptionally unique experience and has enhanced and broadened my understanding of the subject matter. Highly recommend.
